alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 04 at 4:05AM AKST until January 05 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Northeast winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts of 50 to 65 mph expected. Periods of reduced visibility possible due to blowing snow. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...High winds will continue to sweep away loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Tie down small aircraft. Crosswinds may also cause issues for aircraft. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Northeast winds will persist through Wednesday. Wind chill values from 20 below to 35 below zero are expected with these winds. This could cause dangerous life- threatening conditions for those without power, as frostbite can develop in as little as 15 minutes in these conditions.
info.instruction: People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind. Prepare for the possibility of widespread power outages. Use caution if you must drive.
